intro: Henckelia caerulea, commonly known as the bluebell of New Zealand, is a flowering plant native to the forests of New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Henckelia caerulea is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
